Rattrap shrugs as does Straight Shot.

" Beats us guys, Leo wanted us here =
so we did as instructed. "

Straight Shot quietly looks out from the dockin=
g bay.  It was clear that she was upset and a little offended at the same t=
ime.  But only Rattrap knew why as he stands beside her with a paw over her=
 right front haunch, minding the quills on her shoulder blades.

" Don't wo=
rry Prickles, I've had faith in your brother since the first time I saw him=
.  It ain't every day I save a stranger but, I saw something in him, someth=
ing different, and something not everyone could see.  He was sure worth the=
 risk, look where he is now, he's a leader, and yeah he's new ta the job bu=
t, he still has that special something that ya don't see every day."

Strai=
ght Shot turns to him with a smile and a heart felt hug.  Rattrap smiles as=
 he returns the hug.

" Know something Rattrap?  Looks like us rodents gott=
a stick together. "

He nods.

" Definitely.  Since a certain feline seems =
ta be missing the big picture here, you're absolutely right.  I bet he'd le=
arn a thing or two if he got a few quills stuck in his paws. "

Straight Sh=
ot tries not to comment but listens.

" That would definitely get to the po=
int but I dunno.  To me, solving differences happens when you ask to speak =
to someone privately and try to come to a reasonable resolve.  But I sure d=
o dislike the fact that Leo has no personal relation skills.  I mean, serio=
usly, if you want your comrades to respect you but, the leader has ta also =
show a little compassion if he's to be properly respected.  And that's what=
's bothering me.  Is it that hard to be nice as well as authoritative ?  Tu=
cson does that and more and he doesn't even try to. "

Rattrap sighs.

" So=
rta like what your pal Ratchet was like.  He had a temper but he gave it hi=
s all ta save the lives of those who needed saving.  In fact, all those tim=
es he put his life on the line for everyone, just like the old CMO would do=
.  He's also got Ratchet's expressions..  You guys may be more connected ta=
 the old medic in more ways than one.  You too.  You got his heart and so d=
oes your brother."

She looks to him.

" Wait are you saying that Ratchet m=
ight have been our- our dad?"

Rattrap nods.

" Might be, I'm sure we got p=
lenty of intel on it.  I'm sure Legacy will be able ta do a search for us b=
ecause it is your right ta know.  He could've been family and it's your rig=
ht ta find your roots.  I actually wonder if Lord Elder might know a little=
 bit about that..."

Perpetually on the move and constantly busy. 

On Sep =
15, 2011, at 8:11 AM, Super Cyclonus <supercyclonus@...> wrote:

> > =
<OLD>
> >
> > Straight Shot looks back to Leo Prime with a nearly heart bro=
ken expression
> > on her face.
> >
> > " I'll do as you say, but I still t=
hink you don't believe in my brother.
> > There's a difference between beli=
eving and depending. If you don't believe
> > then how can you ever aspire =
with what matters most? A leader without a
> > heart is as good as if there=
 wasn't one ta begin with."
> >
> > She turns to do as ordered, as does Rat=
trap.
> >
> > " My brother might make mistakes but he has something well wo=
rth the
> > compensation. He has a heart and a big one. If you got ta reall=
y know him
> > you would see that too. Cmon Rattrap, we better get going."
=
> 
> <NEW>
> 
> LEO PRIME's optics were the one's of a soldier's as he look=
ed at
> STRAIGHT SHOT as he watched her leave. "Such faith she has in her
>=
 brother." he said quietly to LORD ELDER.
> 
> ELDER nodded, "She has a poi=
nt. It may be that soome of the Predacons
> may learn to change, Blackarach=
nia did for a while."
> 
> There was a grim smile, "Yes, but where is she n=
ow? We haven't seen
> her in years." He looked at ELDER, "Go look after the=
m, i am sure
> there is some grumbling."
> 
> There was a nod from ELDER as=
 he turned and began walking towards the
> docking bay, his optics dim in t=
hought.
> 
> ********
> 
> As RAT TRAP and STRAIGHT SHOT make their way to =
the docking bay
> WINGCALIBER and SANTON were already there, standing by th=
e main door
> talking among themsleves until they noticed the other Maximal=
s
> approaching.
> 
> "So, what is going on?" SANTON said, definitely curio=
us about what was
> happening. "All we got was the mesage to report here."

>

LEO PRIME's optics were the one's of =
a soldier's as he looked at<br>
STRAIGHT SHOT as he watched her leave. "Suc=
h faith she has in her<br>
brother." he said quietly to LORD ELDER.<br>
<br=

ELDER nodded, "She has a point. It may be that soome of the Predacons<br>=

may learn to change, Blackarachnia did for a while."<br>
<br>
There was a =
grim smile, "Yes, but where is she now? We haven't seen<br>
her in years." =
He looked at ELDER, "Go look after them, i am sure<br>
there is some grumbl=
ing."<br>
<br>
There was a nod from ELDER as he turned and began walking to=
wards the<br>
docking bay, his optics dim in thought.<br>

W=
INGCALIBER and SANTON were already there, standing by the main door<br>

king among themsleves until they noticed the other Maximals<br>
approaching=

at was<br>
